result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie E Harris Jr

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:06 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Willie E Harris Jr in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Willie E Harris Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Chernin provides an update; he is requesting the matter be set for plea and sentencing in early December.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing in December.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:15 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Willie E Harris Jr in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Willie E Harris Jr. Atty. Chernin provides an update; he would like some additional time to negotiate an offer with the State.  Atty. Chernin is requesting to have another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:09 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Willie E Harris Jr in court.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Willie E Harris Jr.  Atty. Chernin provides an update, his client has gone through some counseling and he needs time to get reports.  Atty. Chernin request another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:49 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Willie E Harris in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Chernin provides an update, he would like additional time to work out a resolution with the State.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of amended complaint.
The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.

Hearing on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Willie E Harris in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Hearing on February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

COURT ORDERED A $500.00 CASH BOND (APPLY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT PREVIOUSLY POSTED) IN ADDITION TO A $2,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions, including the IID.

Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions, including the IID.

02:17 PM Defendant Willie E Harris in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
